div.p: From Diamantina Bowen to Elizabeth Tierney
M65/4187, unit 209, VPRS 3991 inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 17.8.93. To proof. BEGINNING?? ENDING??
The position, Ladies Leichardt Search Committee, Eliza S. Bromby, sent a copy? of this letter to the Chief Secretary on 6 May 1865.
See also E. Bromby to J. McCulloch, 6 May 1865 (in this edition as M65-05-06).
I regret that my absence from Brisbane has prevented me from acknowledging sooner the receipt of the letters of March 8th & April 6th ult, addressed to me by yourself & other ladies of Victoria.

I warmly sympathize with the object proposed by you — viz to initiate measures for a renewed search for Dr Leichardt. If you will have the goodness to give me more detailed information as to the practical steps which you intend to take, for example, with respect to the organisation of the exploring party, the mode of its direction, the instructions to be given to the leader, etc — I shall be glad to co-operate with you in the way you recommend — ie. by forming a Committee of the Ladies of Queensland.

I am told that it is probable that the Parliament of Queensland will vote a sum of money in aid of any well-considered enterprise of this kind. If the Govt & Legislature of Victoria are likely to co-operate, Sir G. Bowen thinks it would be well that the Chief Secretary at Melbourne should put himself into direct communication on the subject with the Colonial Secretary at Brisbane.
